description: Build complete Pace running app landing page based on campaign brief at /home/user/Attachments/729dfedd-e248-42ac-bc4a-716fd1e2254c.json. Create fullscreen hero section with video background (4m8wxuq0li.mp4 transitioning to h46y3g4zo3.mp4), headline 'Improve your Pace', subheadline about chaos (Strava screenshots, Excel plans, race sites everywhere), body text 'Everything for running in one app', and 'Join waitlist' CTA button linking to form section. Use colors primary #007AFF, secondary #4B6FFF, bg #F6F8FF. Fonts: Montserrat Semibold for headlines, Inter for body. Nike premium aesthetic with clean modern interface.

Create Why Pace section with calm video background (qs44lu51b6.mp4 - liquid glass animation). Headline 'Why Pace exists'. Body text explains the problem: posting runs to Strava for history but it doesn't answer 'What should I do next?'. Strava is a great log but isn't adaptive. Races saved from random websites, plans in spreadsheets, coaches get screenshots in chat. Pace fixes this by putting adaptive plans, races and coaches into one app. Text overlaid on the calm video background.

Create Solution section with 2-column layout combining text and video. Headline 'Improve your Pace. And your pace.' Three features displayed: 1) Adaptive Plans (video 2nqkbf2npz.mp4) - 'Missed a week? Classic plans ignore it. Pace rebuilds your week around real life.' 2) Race Calendar (video 5ek2ofn3m5.mp4) - 'One place for all races. No more searching on random websites.' 3) Coach Platform (video nolgvg0yag.mp4) - 'Coach sees everything in Pace. No screenshots needed. Coach sets training week directly in app.' Include 'See how it works' CTA linking to form.

Create MVP section with centered card layout and video background (2nqkbf2npz.mp4). Headline 'We start simple'. Body text: 'Pace is early in development. The vision is one home for plans, races and coaches in a single app. The first step: adaptive plans that understand when life happens.' Note at bottom: 'Early testers shape the full running home.'

Create final CTA section with full card and form, video background (nolgvg0yag.mp4). Headline 'Start your Pace journey'. Body: 'Join waitlist to test adaptive plans v0.1. Help build the running app you want. Team builders welcome.' Form with email (required) and WhatsApp (optional) fields. Consent text: 'Early access updates about Pace.' Submit button labeled 'Join waitlist'. Form should have clean, premium styling matching the brand.

Apply cinematic Nike-style premium design throughout: high contrast, slightly desaturated color grade with cool tones and subtle blue accents. Use golden hour outdoor light aesthetic, stadium lights at night feel, city dusk skyline vibes. Ensure all videos autoplay, loop seamlessly, and are muted. Smooth scrolling experience. Mobile responsive. Clean, minimal, premium feel. All CTAs should be prominent and use the primary blue color.

Fix Why Pace section overlay - it's too bright and washing out the liquid-glass video background. Reduce the overlay opacity significantly to let the video show through more. The gradient overlay should be much more subtle.

Replace the first hero video with the user's custom video at ./user-video.mov. This should be the video that plays first before transitioning to the second video. Keep all the same transitions and timing.

Replace the second hero video (the one that plays after the first video ends) with ./user-video-2.mp4. This is the video in the 'Improve your Pace' hero section that currently shows chaotic screens. Keep the same transition behavior from first video to this second video.

Apply glassmorphism effect to the 'Why Pace exists' section. Wrap the content in a container with backdrop-filter blur, semi-transparent background, thin white/gray border (border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)), rounded corners (border-radius: 16-20px), and proper padding. The goal is to create a liquid-glass effect similar to the 'We start simple' section, where the blurred background provides contrast for the text while still showing the video behind it. Remove the current dark overlay and replace with this glassmorphism approach.
